rev.comment: the phone has only been released in one market (UK), and there is still a high-level of anticipation in the rest of the worl, in particular the USA
rev.diff:
Line 122: Line 122:
It is also a good idea to discuss the changes on the talk page if you are unsure if they are appropriate to the article
It is also a good idea to discuss the changes on the talk page if you are unsure if they are appropriate to the article

-->
â
Prior to release, the Galaxy Nexus was a highly anticipated phone,<ref>{{cite web|last=Webster |first=Scott |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-19736_7-20116674-251/leaked-galaxy-nexus-details-point-to-verizon-exclusivity/ |title=Leaked Galaxy Nexus details point to Verizon exclusivity | Android Atlas - CNET Reviews |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ice-cream-sandwich-debuted-with-samsung-galaxy-nexus/2011/10/19/gIQALxeM0L_story.html |title=Ice Cream Sandwich debuted with Samsung Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Washington Post |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5850411/rumor-galaxy-nexus-coming-to-verizon-november-10th-for-an-ouchie-300 |title=Rumor: Galaxy Nexus Coming to Verizon November 10th for an Ouchie $300 |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.ibtimes.com/articles/232581/20111017/galaxy-nexus-prime-ice-cream-sandwich-android.htm |title=Galaxy Nexus Prime & Ice Cream Sandwich Release, Price Leaked [VIDEO] - International Business Times |publisher=Newyork.ibtimes.com |date=2011-10-17 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=October 28, 2011 |  8:20 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/10/galaxy-nexus-release-uk.html |title=Galaxy Nexus releasing Nov. 17 - in the U.K. - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Zeman |first=Eric |url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/personal-tech/smart-phones/231900194 |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus: High-End Specs - Personal-tech - Smart Phones |publisher=Informationweek |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref>, and even regarded as the most anticipated Android device of 2011,<ref>http://androidandme.com/2011/11/devices/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been/</ref><ref>http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/</ref><ref>http://cmvlive.com/technology/gadgets/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-offers-super-camera-quality</ref><ref>http://www.mobiledia.com/news/116958.html</ref><ref>http://www.themobilelinks.com/Samsung/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been-/</ref><ref>http://www.androidguys.com/2011/11/14/bell-canada-officially-announces-galaxy-nexus/</ref> gathering very positive reviews.
+
The Galaxy Nexus is a highly anticipated phone<ref>{{cite web|last=Webster |first=Scott |url=http://reviews.cnet.com/8301-19736_7-20116674-251/leaked-galaxy-nexus-details-point-to-verizon-exclusivity/ |title=Leaked Galaxy Nexus details point to Verizon exclusivity | Android Atlas - CNET Reviews |publisher=Reviews.cnet.com |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/ice-cream-sandwich-debuted-with-samsung-galaxy-nexus/2011/10/19/gIQALxeM0L_story.html |title=Ice Cream Sandwich debuted with Samsung Galaxy Nexus |publisher=The Washington Post |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://gizmodo.com/5850411/rumor-galaxy-nexus-coming-to-verizon-november-10th-for-an-ouchie-300 |title=Rumor: Galaxy Nexus Coming to Verizon November 10th for an Ouchie $300 |publisher=Gizmodo.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.ibtimes.com/articles/232581/20111017/galaxy-nexus-prime-ice-cream-sandwich-android.htm |title=Galaxy Nexus Prime & Ice Cream Sandwich Release, Price Leaked [VIDEO] - International Business Times |publisher=Newyork.ibtimes.com |date=2011-10-17 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=October 28, 2011 |  8:20 am |url=http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/technology/2011/10/galaxy-nexus-release-uk.html |title=Galaxy Nexus releasing Nov. 17 - in the U.K. - latimes.com |publisher=Latimesblogs.latimes.com |date= |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Zeman |first=Eric |url=http://www.informationweek.com/news/personal-tech/smart-phones/231900194 |title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus: High-End Specs - Personal-tech - Smart Phones |publisher=Informationweek |date=2011-10-06 |accessdate=2011-10-30}}</ref>, and even regarded as the most anticipated Android device of 2011,<ref>http://androidandme.com/2011/11/devices/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been/</ref><ref>http://mobilesyrup.com/2011/11/17/galaxy-nexus-review-part-1-hardware-overview-video/</ref><ref>http://cmvlive.com/technology/gadgets/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-offers-super-camera-quality</ref><ref>http://www.mobiledia.com/news/116958.html</ref><ref>http://www.themobilelinks.com/Samsung/the-samsung-galaxy-nexus-and-the-launch-that-could-have-been-/</ref><ref>http://www.androidguys.com/2011/11/14/bell-canada-officially-announces-galaxy-nexus/</ref> gathering very positive reviews.
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out. It's understated, sleek, beautiful and packs a display that's destined to drop jaws."<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/18/samsung-galaxy-nexus-hands-on/ Samsung Galaxy Nexus with Ice Cream Sandwich hands-on (video) - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
According to [[Engadget]] editor Darren Murph, the Galaxy Nexus was "smooth as ever. Without question, this is easily the slickest, most polished version of Android yet"<ref>[http://www.engadget.com/2011/10/19/google-ice-cream-sandwich-android-4-0-a-hands-on-screenshot-g/ Google Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0): a hands-on screenshot gallery - Engadget<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> and that "The entire experience just felt polished. In a way, it's as if Android's growing a bit and maturing before our eyes", concluding with "Overall, we're thrilled with how the first [[Android version history#4.x Ice Cream Sandwich|ICS]] handset has turned out.
